news.title: Wednesday Share New “Townies” Video: Watch
news.summary: Lance Bangs directed the music video for the Bleeds song

news.title: Morrissey Cancels Concerts as Canadian Man Is Charged With Online Death Threats Against Him
news.summary: Authorities have charged a 26-year-old with uttering threats to cause death or bodily harm after he allegedly posted on Bluesky about wanting to shoot Morrissey at one of the singer’s shows

news.title: Kneecap Banned From Canada
news.summary: The group said it would take legal action against the Canadian politician who, in announcing the ban, accused Kneecap of advocating for political violence and antisemitism

news.title: D4vd Cancels Tour After Investigators Identify Body in His Tesla as Missing Teenage Girl
news.summary: The singer played a handful of shows after Celeste Rivas’ body was found, but he ceased touring after her identity was made public

news.title: Diane Martel, “Blurred Lines” Video Director, Dies at 63
news.summary: The New York director helmed visuals for Beyoncé, Miley Cyrus, Franz Ferdinand, Jennifer Lopez, and many others

news.title: 10 New Albums You Should Listen to Now: Wednesday, Cardi B, Nine Inch Nails, and More
news.summary: Stream new releases from Wednesday; Cardi B; Nine Inch Nails; Kieran Hebden & William Tyler; Joanne Robertson; Lola Young; Joan Shelley; Múm; Kitba; and Jordan Patterson

news.title: Mitski Covers Pete Townshend’s “Let My Love Open the Door”: Listen
news.summary: The new rendition of the Who rocker’s 1980 solo track is featured on the soundtrack for the new film A Big Bold Beautiful Journey

news.title: Charlotte Gainsbourg Returns With New Song “Blurry Moon”: Watch the Video
news.summary: SebastiAn produced and arranged the French singer’s first new track in years

news.title: Miley Cyrus Shares New Songs With Lindsey Buckingham and David Byrne: Listen
news.summary: “Lockdown” is a 13-minute collaboration with Byrne, while “Secrets” features Buckingham and Mick Fleetwood

news.title: Federal Trade Commission Sues Ticketmaster and Live Nation Entertainment
news.summary: The FTC alleges that the concert giant has knowingly collaborated with secondary market brokers to spike ticket prices
